summary: A "tax offence" refers to illegal activities that violate tax laws and regulations within the European Union. Such offences can include tax evasion, fraud, and other illicit practices aimed at reducing tax liability unlawfully. The EU framework emphasizes the importance of harmonizing criminal law related to tax offences to ensure effective enforcement and cooperation among member states. This includes the establishment of common definitions, penalties, and procedures for prosecution. The EU aims to combat tax offences through various directives and regulations, fostering transparency and accountability in tax matters, thereby enhancing the integrity of the internal market.
